experience: You and Katelyn both know Anthony Argenziano, Petrina B. Thompson, and 54 others
12 years in the recruitment industry and this is the worst I have seen the employment market.
From youth having to look at shelter options, married couples with children losing their homes, skilled, qualified, experienced people battling unemployment. My heart breaks.
My appeal is to all HR and Recruiters out there, please respond to your applications. Even if it's a decline, put yourself in their shoes and treat them with respect.
Recruiters, I know you don't get paid to offer advice, but take a few minutes to see what you can do or where you can guide them, this isn't about money, it's about being human.

To everyone battling unemployment, please don't give up hope. Don't put your future in someone's hands. Be proactive. Reach out to your connections. Change your LinkedIn status to active. Ask for help. Sell your skills. Think out the box.

We now approaching an incredibly tough time of the year, noted as the suicide watch season. Be kinder to one another, lend a helping hand and have empathy. Together I am sure we can make a difference.
